poem:
Bridge Stand  

High above, a protest unfurls,  
the sky a canvas, bold strokes declare,  
Just Stop Oil—silenced, now bound,  
by bars and orders, an echo trapped,  
a voice of the earth buried,  
twice punished, twice denied;  
yet in the quiet, a distant murmur,  
the river flows with resolve.
